intro: Cyathocalyx apoensis, commonly known as the Apo Mountain Cyathocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive calyx-like structure, which is modified into a cup-shaped tube surrounding the floral parts. It typically grows in montane forest habitats, thriving at higher elevations. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in Southeast Asian flora.
